title: Annette Bening looks effortlessly chic in black blouse as she attends Hope Gap premiere
text:
She is a four time Oscar nominee and among the greats in Hollywood.

And Annette Bening looked effortlessly chic as she attended the premiere of her film Hope during the 63rd BFI London Film Festival on Friday.

The actress, 61, wowed in a black blouse adorned with silver buttons which cinched in at her slender waist.

Chic: Annette Bening looked effortlessly chic as she attended the premiere of her film Hope during the 63rd BFI London Film Festival on Friday

The American Beauty star paired this with culottes with a loose flare, and leather boots.

Her platinum crop was styled in a sleek sidepart while her pretty features were enhanced with a radiant palette of make-up.

She slipped on a chic pair of shades.

Hope Gap tells the tale of a couple's visit with their son - which takes a dramatic turn when the father tells him he plans on leaving his mother.

Sleek: The actress, 61, wowed in a black blouse adorned with silver buttons which cinched in at her slender waist as she posed with director William Nicholson

Smile: Her platinum crop was styled in a sleek sidepart while her pretty features were enhanced with a radiant palette of make-up

Bill Nighy - who was not spotted on the red carpet - plays the role of Edward in the film.

Bening is coming off the Marvel box office blockbuster Captain Marvel, where she played Dr. Wendy Lawson

The actress is also attached to star in Turn of Mind, alongside Michelle Pfeiffer.

Annette is married to Hollywood legend Warren Beatty, the pair, who fell in love on the 1990 set of Bugsy - just celebrated an impressive 27 years of marriage on March 3.

The Beattys are also parents to daughters Isabel, 22; and Ella, 19; as well as son Benjamin, 24.

Delight: The star looked delighted to be promoting the film
description: Annette Bening looked effortlessly chic as she attended the premiere of her film Hope  during the 63rd BFI London Film Festival on Friday.
